[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec + ValueCodec] [Database transaction isolation] Does the schema guarantee that concurrent transactions don't see partial write states, or can read-your-writes issues corrupt tree reads? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Schema] [Disk corruption detection] Can the schema detect disk-level corruption in encoded keys/values, or will corrupted bytes propagate as valid nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec trait] [Trait implementation safety] Can a malicious KeyCodec implementation be injected for NodeKey that bypasses schema validation, encoding arbitrary database keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [ValueCodec trait] [Trait implementation safety] Can a malicious ValueCodec implementation for Node serialize invalid state that bypasses all schema validation checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [SeekKeyCodec trait] [Trait implementation safety] Can SeekKeyCodec be implemented for types other than (Version, u8), breaking seek operation assumptions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec] [Decode error handling] Does decode_key() return specific error types that allow recovery, or do generic errors mask the root cause of decode failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [ValueCodec] [Decode error handling] Does decode_value() distinguish between NodeDecodeError variants (EmptyInput, UnknownTag, NoChildren, ExtraLeaves), or are they handled uniformly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec + ValueCodec] [Error propagation] Can decode errors be silenced by upper layers, causing corrupted nodes to be used without detection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec + ValueCodec] [Panic safety] Can any encode/decode operation panic instead of returning Err(), causing validator crashes during state operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Schema] [StaleNodeIndex dependency] Does JellyfishMerkleNodeSchema properly coordinate with StaleNodeIndexSchema for node pruning, or can inconsistencies leave orphaned stale indices? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Schema] [Transaction dependency] Can nodes written via JellyfishMerkleNodeSchema reference transaction versions that don't exist in LedgerInfoSchema, causing temporal inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Schema] [Encoding format changes] If NodeKey or Node encoding format changes in a protocol upgrade, can old nodes become undecodable, causing state access failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Schema] [Backward compatibility] Does the schema support reading nodes encoded by older software versions, or does upgrade require full state re-encoding? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Schema] [Forward compatibility] Can newer nodes with extended fields be partially decoded by older validators, or will this cause consensus divergence during rolling upgrades? (Critical)
